org.grouplens.lenskit.eval.data.crossfold

Class CrossfoldTask

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.common.util.concurrent.AbstractFuture<T>
      • org.grouplens.lenskit.eval.AbstractTask<java.util.List<TTDataSet>>
        • org.grouplens.lenskit.eval.data.crossfold.CrossfoldTask
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ListenableFuture<java.util.List<TTDataSet>>, java.util.concurrent.Future<java.util.List<TTDataSet>>, EvalTask<java.util.List<TTDataSet>>

    public class CrossfoldTask
extends AbstractTask<java.util.List<TTDataSet>>
    The command to build and run a crossfold on the data source file and output the partition files

      • getSampleSize

        public int getSampleSize()

      • setSampleSize

        public CrossfoldTask setSampleSize(int n)
        Set the sample size (# of users sampled per partition). Only meaningful when the method is CrossfoldMethod.SAMPLE_USERS.
        Parameters:
        n - The number of users to sample for each partition.
        Returns:
        The task (for chaining).

      • setTrain

        public CrossfoldTask setTrain(java.lang.String pat)
        Set the pattern for the training set files. The pattern should have a single format conversion capable of taking an integer ('%s' or '%d') which will be replaced with the fold number.
        Parameters:
        pat - The training file name pattern.
        Returns:
        The CrossfoldCommand object (for chaining)
        See Also:
        String.format(String, Object...)

      • setTest

        public CrossfoldTask setTest(java.lang.String pat)
        Set the pattern for the test set files.
        Parameters:
        pat - The test file name pattern.
        Returns:
        The CrossfoldCommand object (for chaining)
        See Also:
        setTrain(String)

      • setOrder

        public CrossfoldTask setOrder(Order<Rating> o)
        Set the order for the train-test splitting. To split a user's ratings, the ratings are first ordered by this order, and then partitioned.
        Parameters:
        o - The sort order.
        Returns:
        The CrossfoldCommand object (for chaining)
        See Also:
        RandomOrder, TimestampOrder, setHoldoutFraction(double), setHoldout(int)

      • setHoldout

        public CrossfoldTask setHoldout(int n)
        Set holdout to a fixed number of items per user. Only meaningful when the method is CrossfoldMethod.PARTITION_USERS.
        Parameters:
        n - The number of items to hold out from each user's profile.
        Returns:
        The CrossfoldCommand object (for chaining)

      • setRetain

        public CrossfoldTask setRetain(int n)
        Set holdout from using the retain part to a fixed number of items. Only meaningful when the method is CrossfoldMethod.PARTITION_USERS.
        Parameters:
        n - The number of items to train data set from each user's profile.
        Returns:
        The CrossfoldCommand object (for chaining)

      • setHoldoutFraction

        public CrossfoldTask setHoldoutFraction(double f)
        Set holdout to a fraction of each user's profile. Only meaningful when the method is CrossfoldMethod.PARTITION_USERS.
        Parameters:
        f - The fraction of a user's ratings to hold out.
        Returns:
        The CrossfoldCommand object (for chaining)

      • setSource

        public CrossfoldTask setSource(DataSource source)
        Set the input data source.
        Parameters:
        source - The data source to use.
        Returns:
        The CrossfoldCommand object (for chaining)

      • setForce

        public CrossfoldTask setForce(boolean force)
        Set the force running option of the command. The crossfold will be forced to ran with the isForced set to true regardless of whether the partition files are up to date.
        Parameters:
        force - The force to run option
        Returns:
        The CrossfoldCommand object (for chaining)

      • setSplitUsers

        @Deprecated
public void setSplitUsers(boolean splitUsers)
        Deprecated. Use setMethod(CrossfoldMethod) instead.
        Configure whether it splits per-user or per-rating.
        Parameters:
        splitUsers - true to split by users (CrossfoldMethod.PARTITION_USERS), false to split by rating (CrossfoldMethod.PARTITION_RATINGS).

      • getMethod

        public CrossfoldMethod getMethod()
        Get the method to be used for crossfolding.
        Returns:
        The configured crossfold method.

      • setMethod

        public CrossfoldTask setMethod(CrossfoldMethod m)
        Set the crossfold method. The default is CrossfoldMethod.PARTITION_USERS.
        Parameters:
        m - The crossfold method to use.

      • setCache

        public CrossfoldTask setCache(boolean on)
        Configure whether the data sets created by the crossfold will have caching turned on.
        Parameters:
        on - Whether the data sets returned should cache.
        Returns:
        The command (for chaining)

      • setIsolate

        public CrossfoldTask setIsolate(boolean on)
        Configure whether the train-test data sets generated by this task will be isolated. If yes, then each data set will be in its own isolation group; otherwise, they will all be in the default isolation group (the all-zero UUID).
        Parameters:
        on - true to produce isolated data sets.
        Returns:
        The task (for chaining).

      • getIsolate

        public boolean getIsolate()
        Query whether this task will produce isolated data sets.
        Returns:
        true if this task will produce isolated data sets.

      • setWriteTimestamps

        public CrossfoldTask setWriteTimestamps(boolean pack)
        Configure whether to include timestamps in the output file.
        Parameters:
        pack - true to include timestamps (the default), false otherwise.
        Returns:
        The task (for chaining).

      • getWriteTimestamps

        public boolean getWriteTimestamps()
        Query whether timestamps will be written.
        Returns:
        true if output will include timestamps.

        public java.util.List<TTDataSet> perform()
                                  throws TaskExecutionException

      • splitUsers

        protected Long2IntMap splitUsers(UserDAO dao)
        Split users ids to n splits, where n is the partitionCount
        Parameters:
        dao - The DAO of the source file
        Returns:
        a map of users to partition numbers. Users not in a partition will return -1.
